issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Query Processor
components.description: Tracks issues dealing with query processing.

fields.description:
path uris in input split are missing scheme (it's fixed on cdh3u6 and hadoop 1.0)

fields.summary: Hive 0.11.0 is not working with pre-cdh3u6 and hadoop-0.23

comments.body:
navis requested code review of "HIVE-4619 [jira] Hive 0.11.0 is not working with cdh3u5".

Reviewers: JIRA

HIVE-4619 Hive 0.11.0 is not working with cdh3u5

path uris in input split are missing scheme (it's fixed in cdh3u6)

TEST PLAN
  EMPTY

REVISION DETAIL
  https://reviews.facebook.net/D10971

AFFECTED FILES
  ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/exec/MapOperator.java

MANAGE HERALD RULES
  https://reviews.facebook.net/herald/view/differential/

WHY DID I GET THIS EMAIL?
  https://reviews.facebook.net/herald/transcript/26217/

To: JIRA, navis

Could we get this in for the 0.12 release?

I've been using this patch in production for weeks and it works at least for me.

This message is automatically generated.
I'd be fine committing this if you submit a patch that applies.
This patch applies cleanly for me on current trunk.
I just verified this patch fixes the issue with cdh4.3
